snippet: The story of Gul Meena, who was accused of adultery and struck by an ax 15 times, is also the story of a society struggling with shifting attitudes about women.
abstract: Story of Gul Meena, Afghan woman who miraculously survived attempted honor killing, gives insight into deeply entrenched tribal culture and society struggling to come to terms with different way of thinking about women; as Western money and presence in country are dwindling, women's advocates fear limited gains made for women will erode.

byline.contributor: Sangar Rahimi contributed reporting from Jalalabad, and an employee of The New York Times from Kunar Province.

lead_paragraph: The story of Gul Meena, who was accused of adultery and struck by an ax 15 times, is also the story of a society struggling with shifting attitudes about women.

headline.seo: With Aid, Afghan ‘Honor’ Victim Inches Back
headline.main: With Help, Afghan Survivor of ‘Honor Killing’ Inches Back
headline.print_headline: With Help, Afghan ‘Honor’ Victim Inches Back
